column1: 0$Condition: Convulsive Seizures$7/19/2015 8:39:11 AM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$This medicine is extremely effective
column2: and I highly reccomend it!
55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $3$3$5$"I am taking this medication for Bipolar Disorder II
column3: which means that although I cycle from depression to mania
column4: I don't have illusions and I never do anything that is extremely destructive to myself.  I have had the side effect of grinding my teeth
column5: tightening my jaw and sucking or grinding the sides of my cheeks into my teeth.  As a result
column6: the inside of my mouth is always sore.  When I first started taking it
column7: it negatively impacted my driving.  I wasn't as aware as I should have been and found myself cutting people off
column8: running into curbs and once backed into another car because I didn't notice it.  Fortunately
column9: this has subsided and I am once again a safe driver.  My cycles are better with it
column10: but not gone.  The doctor added Abilify during the last two yeaers and I was doing great.  During the last two weeks I have tried eliminating the Abilify
column11: as it is so expensive.  I have now felt quite depressed
column12: overwhelmed and edgy for about a week.  Definitely going back on the Abilify.  As I have never tried Abilify without the Lamictal
column13: it might just be that the Abilify is what is ""fixing"" me and the Lamictal is doing nothing.  When I am good and stable again with the Abilify
column14: I might try leaving off the Lamictal to see what happens.    "

column1: 2$Condition: Convulsive Seizures$8/12/2014 4:24:21 PM$Reviewer: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I have been on this medication for 2 and a half years. I take the XR 200 mg once a day. I am happy to say I completed one whole year seizure free August the 7th. Although I do not suffer from bipolar depression or anything like that
column2: I find that if I take an extra pill when I feel irritable or if I have a really bad migraine
column3: I feel sooo much better. Although I do have a horrible memory. I thought it was just me
column4: but reading the reviews made me feel better because I know I'm not crazy. The generic is no good for me. I had really bad side effects
column6: that's why I've only been seizure free for a year because I refused to take the generic. But since I've been on the brand name I have never felt better.

column2: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$5$5$
19-24 Male  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$"My son has been on this for over 2 1/2 years
column3: he's now 21 and never has had a seizure or passing out while on this medication.  Keppra had him so zombified and memory well he couldn't remember nothing and felt like a vegetable and SEVERELY depressed..so that was NOT an option as well as other side effects.  My son is on 100mg lamictal xr once a day and it works GREAT for him... I do notice sometimes he may be a little out of breath here and there than normally but he's very active and works out and i think this helps... he does get dehydrated more than usual being on this medicine so he drinks alot of water.  When the neurologists tried to ween him off and take him off of this medicine he had 2 seizures in one month! Thank god we found a medicine that his body tolerates and is doing well on!  They cannot find anything wrong so i guess they diagnosed him as having epilepsy pretty much.  Now when they tried to up him up to a 150mg he had stomach cramps
column4: insomnia...chest pains... that just does NOT work for him.  The neuros said that shouldn't be from the medicine
column5: and I told them he did not have any of those symptoms until they raised the mg's.  So he's at 100mg once day and he has had NO problems
column6: thank you Jesus.  Also you can get on GLAXO SMITH KLINE website and possibly get patient financial assistance.  He gets his 3 months at a time for FREE!!!! He's a full time student and still lives @ home
column7: but there is a chance you could get help for this medicine... check into it..

column1: or bridgestoaccess.com Hope this helps everybody! Good Luck and God Bless you ALL!!!"

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$5$5$I began taking this medication about a year ago due to black-out seizures and rage.  I haven't had ANY episodes since the start of the medication.  I take 100mg 1x day
column3: but I did have to start taking it at night as it made me drowsy... I take it with 50mg of benadryl at night and sleep better than I have in years.

column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $3$3$5$200 mg daily with 300 mg topiramate daily for grand mal seizures; the topiramate seems to be controlling the seizures more than the Lamictal XR. Some side effects; main ones are major loss of coordination
column7: it isn't that bad of a medication
column8: but is costly if you don't have prescription insurance.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient) $3$5$5$I have seizures due to MS.  Lesion on the wrong part of the brain kinda thing.   I've been on this drug only 9 days and can't truly speak to it's total effectiveness but - wow.   I still have seizures but not nearly as many therefore no new fractures.  This drug DOES give me a boost of energy.   I am wired for sound 15 minutes after taking it and it lasts about 10 hours.   Pretty good boon for an MS patient.   It does make me dizzier and a bit ditzier but I'll take that.

35-44 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $5$5$5$It has helped by keeping me more balanced emotionally. Before I always dreaded the next morning because I didn't know how I would be feeling. Now I can predict my moods because they don't change so fast.
25-34 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$3$I have complex partial seizures
column3: and I take 400 mg Lamictal XR 2x a day
column4: and 100 topamax at bed.  I had some problems at the beginning
column5: but I have trouble starting every drug I've ever used.  It's worked really well w/ my seizures.  I get some occasional dizziness and dehydration
column6: which may actually be from the topamax.

column2: Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$4$5$taking for bipolar 2
column4: interfering with bulimia trtmt. before this
column5: i was manic and crashing several times a day
column8: resorted to behaviors such as b/p
column11: etc to control my mood. after 2ish wks on this
column12: felt much more stable and NORMAL- not acting like a nutcase and then having self-esteem crashes that make functioning impossible. im going thru a very stressful period right now i think that has triggered some of the problems ive been having with more manic symptoms
column13: but its much better than it has been and im so glad i got over my fear of psychotropic meds. no weight gain
column16: and trust me these worried me because im bulimic and by definition very vain and irrational about these sorts of things.

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$1$5$I agree with the an earlier review. I have had problems with headaches

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $5$2$5$It works very well at controlling my seizures. I have not had any since being on it. I noticed no one else has mentioned this. Am I the only one???
Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $2$1$5$can be suicidal for months without antidepresants and klonopin
45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient) $5$2$5$Lamictal XR is very easy to take
column3: and I have had no seizures in the year I have been taking it. I was on regular Lamictal before for a few years
column5: but had waves of slight dizziness
column6: which the XR has eliminated. The only potential problem I have with this drug is that my memory is getting to be terrible
column7: heading toward dementia symptoms. The other day I had run out of my meds
column8: and didn't take it until about lunchtime. I was so clear headed and able to remember a list of four things to get at the store! That was so cool! That is when I began to suspect this med may play into my symptoms. Has anyone else had this problem?

17$Condition: Simple Partial Seizures$9/19/2010 6:23:07 PM$Reviewer: stewdaniel, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $3$4$5$I have partial seizures. I was on Zonegran which made me severely depressed. I switched to Lamictal XR one tablet in am & 2 @ bedtime. I had another seizure about two weeks ago. Dr.'s since then raised my Lamictal XR to 2 tabs in the am & 2 tabs @ bedtime. We will see how that works. I am starting to get the smell AGAIN right before I have another seizure. No weight gain and no depression with this medication. Time will tell....

19$Condition: Simple Partial Seizures$5/5/2010 6:32:10 PM$Reviewer: Brittany720, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$2$4$I have partial seizures that don't happen too often but they suggested that I take medication for it. Now they have decided to put me on keppra for my seizures, but it has made me very drowzy. I quit smoking 2 months ago and this medication is making me crave ciggarettes.
20$Condition: Simple Partial Seizures$5/5/2010 1:04:45 PM$Reviewer: megs, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $4$1$3$I have temporal lobe epilepsy in my left temporal lobe and I suffer simple partial seizures.  I took Keppra for years and it worked wonders but turned my memory to mush.  My doctor recommended Lamictal.  Right now I take it along with my Keppra.  I don't particularly care for Lamictal, it makes me a little jumpy and it gives me a feeling of artificial happiness ( if that even makes sense).  I am a happy person.  My seizures are increasing as the Keppra is decreased and the Lamictal is increased.  I think I will stick with Keppra, eventhough my doctor thinks I should stick with the Lamictal.  I also have trouble finding the XR, and it takes my pharmacy  a week to get it.

column1: 23$Condition: Simple Partial Seizures$3/24/2010 8:30:35 PM$Reviewer: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 6 months to less than 1 year (Patient) $3$2$5$I experience complex partial seizures as a result of a non-malignant spot on my brain.  I started taking Lamictal XR and it was WONDERFUL for about the first 4 months.  Then all of a sudden my seizures came back with a vengeance.  I was having them several times a day.  My neurologist doubled my dosage.  That was about 4 months ago.  Since then my seizured happen about once a month.  I just don't want them to happen at all.  This is the only medication I've ever had for this condition so I don't know if this is good or not but I still get seizures so I'd say overall I'm not completely satisfied
column2: but it has definitely made a tremendous difference.
